Player

Class Mp3

  • java.lang.Object
    • Player.Mp3
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Mp3>

    public class Mp3
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Mp3>
    Mp3 container class, this fetches and makes easily accessible all the metadata contained in the Mp3 or, if not present, sets default properties.
    Author:
    Group 25

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.lang.String album
      Track album, read from the mp3's metadata.
      private java.lang.String artist
      Track artist, read from the mp3's metadata.
      private double duration
      Track duration, in seconds.
      private java.lang.String durStr
      String representation of this Mp3's duration, for stringing.
      private java.lang.String fileLocation
      String representation of the filepath to the mp3 on disk.
      private int songId
      Unique integer identifier to be assigned on creation.
      private java.lang.String title
      Track title, read from the mp3's metadata.
      private int upvoteCount
      This track's current upvote count.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Mp3

        public Mp3(java.lang.String filePath,
   int id)
        Constructor for the Mp3 class. Initializes all metadata and creates a file pointer to the mp3 who's filepath is passed in arguments.
        Parameters:
        filePath - A string representation of the file location.
        id - Unique integer identifier for this Mp3.

                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         org.farng.mp3.TagException

        java.io.IOException
        org.farng.mp3.TagException

      • parseMetaData

        public java.lang.String[] parseMetaData()
        Parses the Mp3's metadata for use by the rest of the program into a string list.
        Returns:
        A string list consisting of the songId, title, artist, song length, and album title.

      • getShortTitle

        public java.lang.String getShortTitle()
        Returns a shortened (45-character max) version of the song title.
        Returns:
        String that is, at maximum, 45 characters in length, with the last 3 characters being "...".
